0 Activate Do Not Disturb feature.
0 Enable blocking of outgoing Caller ID.
0 Enable call waiting for every call.
1 Enable attended call transfer.
1 Enable blind call transfer.
1 Enable 3-way conference.
0 Activate blocking of anonymous incoming call.
0 Enable automatic phone number lookup when dialing.
20 Number of seconds before forwarding to VoiceMailNumber.
0xffffffff Control whether a call preference option is displayed.
0xffffffff Control whether a call preference option can be set by user.
Network Parameters
0 Password for HTTP configuration interface (0 = disabled).
1 Enable TFTP server for ATA configuration.
0 Specify IP address or URL of the TFTP server.
3600 Period to check for updates to configuration. Random number from 1-1800 is added.
Enable DHCP
1 If 1, enable DHCP.
0.0.0.0 Statically assigned IP address.
0.0.0.0 Statically assigned default router IP address.
255.255.255.0 Statically assigned IP subnet mask.
0.0.0.0 Statically assigned primary DNS server address.
0.0.0.0 Statically assigned secondary DNS server address.
0.0.0.0 Statically assigned NTP server IP address.
0.0.0.0 Statically assigned alternate NTP server IP address.
0 (no documentation found)
0.0.0.0 WAN IP address of the attached router/NAT (SIP behind a NAT).
0 Server to which dummy UDP packets are sent to maintain a NAT translation for a session.

OpFlags
.BM.OpFlags
0x0 Various operational features.
TFTP configuration filename .BF.0.OpFlags
0 Use only internal default TFTP configuration filename.
Network probing on power up .BF.1.OpFlags
1 Do not perform static network router probing at power up.
DHCP option 150 .BF.3.OpFlags
0 Do not ask for DHCP option 150 in DHCP DISCOVERY message.
VLAN network operation .BF.4.OpFlags
0 User the static VLAN ID specified in VLANSetting.
VLAN encapsulation .BF.5.OpFlags
0 Do not use VLAN IP encapsulation.
Cisco Discovery Protocol .BF.6.OpFlags
0 Do not perform CDP discovery.
Web configuration access .BF.7.OpFlags
0 Do not allow web configuration.
HTTP refresh access .BF.8.OpFlags
0 Do not allow http://ip/refresh.
HTTP reset access .BF.9.OpFlags
0 Do not allow reset via http://ip/reset.
Hostname of device .BF.10.OpFlags
0 In DHCP packets use device's name as hostname (DHCP option 12).
DNS servers 1 .BF.13.OpFlags
0 Use both DHCP provided (preferred) and statically configured DNS IPs.
DNS servers 2 .BF.14.OpFlags
0 Use both statically configured (preferred) and DHCP provided DNS IPs.
Disable UDP checksum .BF.15.OpFlags
0 Disable generation of UDP checksum in outgoing UDP packets.
Password protection .BF.28.OpFlags
6
0
0 Factory Reset and Local Upgrade protected by UIPassword also.

SIP Parameters
0 Use LoginID as the authentication ID, otherwise use UID.
1 Enable SIP registration.
900 SIP registration renewal interval in seconds.
0 Backup proxy address (0 = disabled).
0 Timeout before failing back to primary proxy server (0 = not until backup fails).
OutBoundProxy
0 SIP proxy server to which all outgoing SIP requests are sent.
5060 The device port for SIP requests.
16384 The base port for RTP media.
5 Maximum number of forwards for a call.
1800 Interval between SIP session refreshes (seconds).
1800 Minimum required interval between SIP session refreshes.
MsgRetryLimits
.BM.MsgRetryLimits
0x0 Configure retry limits.
Retransmit SIP requests .BF.0.MsgRetryLimits
0 Except those listed below and final response to INVITE. 0 = default values, NOTIFY 6, PRACK 5, response to INVITE 7
Retransmit REGISTER requests .BF.4.MsgRetryLimits
0 0 = default value (10 times)
Retransmit INVITE request .BF.8.MsgRetryLimits
0 0 = default value (2 times)
Retransmit BYE request .BF.12.MsgRetryLimits
0 0 = default value (4 times)
Retransmit CANCEL request .BF.16.MsgRetryLimits
0 0 = default value (4 times)
Retransmit REFER request .BF.20.MsgRetryLimits
0 0 = default value (5 times)

FeatureTimer
.BM.FeatureTimer
0x0 Timing values for telephone features
Maximum time redialing busy line .BF.0.FeatureTimer
0 0 = default (30 minutes), 5 minutes increment, range 1-15 = 5-75 min.
Retry interval if line is busy .BF.4.FeatureTimer
0 0 = default (15 seconds), 15 seconds increment, range 1-15 = 15-225 sec.
On-hook delay before disconnect .BF.8.FeatureTimer
0 0 = no delay, 5 seconds increment, range 0-31 = 0-155 sec.
Delay before ringing... .BF.13.FeatureTimer
0 Delay before ringing the phone after a 183 Session Progress is received during callback on busy. 0 = no waiting, 1 second increment, range 0-7 sec.
Ring timeout for call waiting .BF.16.FeatureTimer
0 0 = never timeout, 10 seconds increment, range 1-7 = 10-70 sec.
FeatureTimer2
.BM.FeatureTimer2
0x0 Control timing of certain telephone features
Max time ethernet can be disc. before reboot .BF.0.FeatureTimer2
30 In seconds, 0 to disable this feature

Period between call waiting tones .BF.0.SigTimer

5 63 = never, 1 second increment, range 0-62 sec.
Ring timeout for incoming calls .BF.14.SigTimer
6 0 = ring forever, 10 seconds increment, range 1-63 = 10-630 sec.

20 1 second increment, range 0-63 sec.
